intro: Cortiella hedinii, commonly known as the Hedin's cortiella, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Trapeliaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically pale yellow to orange in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and an alga, which allows it to thrive in various habitats. It is often found on rocks and tree bark in arid and semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecological niche.
